str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
From a presumed derivative of histemi; to set fast, i.e. to turn resolutely in a certain direction, or to confirm.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A proclamation, preaching. From kerusso; a proclamation.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
An unveiling, uncovering, revealing, revelation. From apokalupto; disclosure.
From a derivative of muo; a secret or 'mystery'.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Neuter Singular
str2: Intrans: I am silent, keep silence; trans: I keep secret; pass: I am kept secret. From sige; to keep silent.
